|Title=Photography/video of peripheral facial paralysis (PFP)
|Description=None
|Rubric=Multimedia content
|Contributors=
|Order=3}}
Please refer to the CEN website: www.cen-neurologie.fr where videos are available.

question.title: Question
question.description: In a video demonstrating peripheral facial paralysis (PFP), which of the following signs would likely be observed?

option_a.title: Option A
option_a.description: The patient's eye on the affected side is unable to close completely.

option_b.title: Option B
option_b.description: The patient displays enhanced facial symmetry compared to the unaffected side.

option_c.title: Option C
option_c.description: The patient's affected side shows hyperactive blink reflex.

option_d.title: Option D
option_d.description: The patient's facial muscles on the affected side exhibit spontaneous recovery.
